00046 /* Define whether inttypes.h is available */
00047 #ifndef U_HAVE_INTTYPES_H
00048 #define U_HAVE_INTTYPES_H 0
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 /*
00052  * Define what support for C++ streams is available.
00053  *     If U_IOSTREAM_SOURCE is set to 199711, then <iostream> is available
00054  * (1997711 is the date the ISO/IEC C++ FDIS was published), and then
00055  * one should qualify streams using the std namespace in ICU header
00056  * files.
00057  *     If U_IOSTREAM_SOURCE is set to 198506, then <iostream.h> is
00058  * available instead (198506 is the date when Stroustrup published
00059  * "An Extensible I/O Facility for C++" at the summer USENIX conference).
00060  *     If U_IOSTREAM_SOURCE is 0, then C++ streams are not available and
00061  * support for them will be silently suppressed in ICU.
00062  *
00063  */
00064 
00065 #ifndef U_IOSTREAM_SOURCE
00066 #define U_IOSTREAM_SOURCE 199711
00067 #endif
00068

00102 /* Define 64 bit limits */
00103 #if !U_INT64_IS_LONG_LONG
00104 # ifndef INT64_C
00105 #  define INT64_C(x) ((int64_t)x)
00106 # endif
00107 # ifndef UINT64_C
00108 #  define UINT64_C(x) ((uint64_t)x)
00109 # endif
00110 /* else use the umachine.h definition */
00111 #endif

00113 /*===========================================================================*/
00114 /* Generic data types                                                        */
00115 /*===========================================================================*/
00116 
00117 /* If your platform does not have the <inttypes.h> header, you may
00118    need to edit the typedefs below. */
00119 #if U_HAVE_INTTYPES_H
00120 #include <inttypes.h>
00121 #else /* U_HAVE_INTTYPES_H */
00122 
00123 #if ! U_HAVE_INT8_T
00124 typedef signed char int8_t;
00125 #endif
00126 
00127 #if ! U_HAVE_UINT8_T
00128 typedef unsigned char uint8_t;
00129 #endif
00130 
00131 #if ! U_HAVE_INT16_T
00132 typedef signed short int16_t;
00133 #endif
00134 
00135 #if ! U_HAVE_UINT16_T
00136 typedef unsigned short uint16_t;
00137 #endif
00138 
00139 #if ! U_HAVE_INT32_T
00140 typedef signed int int32_t;
00141 #endif
00142 
00143 #if ! U_HAVE_UINT32_T
00144 typedef unsigned int uint32_t;
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 #if ! U_HAVE_INT64_T
00148 #if U_INT64_IS_LONG_LONG
00149     typedef signed long long int64_t;
00150 #else
00151     typedef signed __int64 int64_t;
00152 #endif
00153 #endif
00154 
00155 #if ! U_HAVE_UINT64_T
00156 #if U_INT64_IS_LONG_LONG
00157     typedef unsigned long long uint64_t;
00158 #else
00159     typedef unsigned __int64 uint64_t;
00160 #endif
00161 #endif
00162 #endif

00173 /* Determines the endianness of the platform */

00176 /* 1 or 0 to enable or disable threads.  If undefined, default is: enable threads. */
00177 #define ICU_USE_THREADS 1
00178 
00179 /* On strong memory model CPUs (e.g. x86 CPUs), we use a safe & quick double check mutex lock. */
00180 /*
00181 Microsoft can define _M_IX86, _M_AMD64 (before Visual Studio 8) or _M_X64 (starting in Visual Studio 8). 
00182 Intel can define _M_IX86 or _M_X64
00183 */
00184 #if defined(_M_IX86) || defined(_M_AMD64) || defined(_M_X64) || (defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__)))
00185 #define UMTX_STRONG_MEMORY_MODEL 1
00186 #endif
